sentences: Gregory Allen Kurstin (born May 14, 1969) is an American record producer, multi-instrumentalist, and songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: He has won eight Grammy Awards, including Producer of the Year, Non-Classical in 2017 and 2018, and written and produced four songs that hit #1 on the Billboard Hot 100.
section: N/A

sentences: Kurstin collaborated with Adele on the albums 25 and 30.
section: N/A

sentences: He co-wrote and produced "Easy on Me,"  the first single from 30, which hit the US Hot 100 only five hours after its release and broke all-time records on Spotify with 24 million plays within the first 24 hours it was available.
section: N/A

sentences: He also co-wrote, produced and played most of the instruments on Adele's record-breaking 2015 single "Hello".
section: N/A

sentences: Among others, he has worked with Sia, Kelly Clarkson, Halsey, Maren Morris, Beck, Paul McCartney, Pink, Lily Allen, and the Foo Fighters.
section: N/A

sentences: He often plays guitar, bass, keyboards and drums, and engineers and programs the records he produces.
section: N/A

sentences: Kurstin began his career as a jazz pianist and later co-founded Geggy Tah.
section: N/A

sentences: He has collaborated with Inara George in The Bird and the Bee since 2004.

== Early life and education ==

sentences: Early life and education
section: == Early life and education ==
== Early life and education ==

sentences: Born and raised in Los Angeles, California, Kurstin started playing piano at age 5.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Soon after, he picked up guitar and bass.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Kurstin joined his first band at the age of 11, and at 12 co-wrote "Crunchy Water", the B-side to classmate Dweezil Zappa's "My Mother Is a Space Cadet".
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: In high school, Kurstin focused on jazz piano.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: After graduation, he moved to New York to study with Charles Mingus' pianist Jaki Byard at The New School for Jazz and Contemporary Music.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: In addition to coursework, as a student Kurstin played with prominent jazz artists including Bobby Hutcherson, George Coleman, and Charles McPherson.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: He returned to Los Angeles to finish his degree, and graduated from the California Institute of the Arts with a BFA in 1992.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: In a 2013 interview, Kurstin said that his education in jazz had played a vital role in his pop success.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: "It's still something I carry over into my pop music work.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: It's really important to me that the notes I'm choosing strike the right emotional chord."
section: == Early life and education ==
